job.title: Software Engineer, Growth
job.description: <strong><u>About Ninja<br><br></u></strong>At Ninja, we are building delivery-only convenience stores that deliver in 10 minutes or less. It's a service that feels like magic. We are a rapidly growing startup building an exceptional team. Come be a part of our early journey in becoming a household name in last mile delivery across North America and the world.<br><br>We are venture-backed by the same investors of iconic companies like DoorDash.<br><br><strong><u>Overview<br><br></u></strong>As one of the first members of the Engineering team, you will need to be a generalist that can contribute at every part of the stack, not only in engineering, but across the whole company. You need to be a product-focused engineer that is highly analytical, and can pull insights from our data to shape our product.<br><br>Your responsibilities<br><ul><li>Setup A/B tests to improve different funnels for increased retention, order growth, and increased basket sizes</li><li>Come up with hypotheses on our user behaviours, and write code to pull insights out of our data to answer these hypotheses</li><li>Work with our customer facing engineering teams to come up with new features and strategies to reduce our CAC and increase LTV<br></li></ul><strong><u>Requirements<br></u></strong><ul><li>You have experience working on growth at a high growth startup</li><li>Strong SQL skills</li><li>You have strong software engineering fundamentals with a passion for high quality code</li><li>You understand how to make tradeoffs that lead to the biggest business impact with the limited time that you have<br></li></ul><u><strong>Benefits<br></strong></u><ul><li>Work directly with the founder to shape the direction of our service and product</li><li>Steep learning curve and career growth trajectory. We're growing at breakneck speeds and we want a team that grows with us!</li><li>An opportunity to help build a potentially iconic company in its early days</li><li>Equity in a fast growing, early stage startup</li></ul>
